content.content: I want to begin a discussion about the possibility of the community creating something like an Optimism University, an online educational Hub for the ecosystem. The Hub could offer various types of Free training tools and courses for the next generation of builders, users, investors, etc. Content mediums could range from a recorded class model like Coursera, to live seminars and “labs”, to manuals, articles and more and could perhaps be produced in part by key figures at various dapps and projects who are willing to impart their knowledge to those who could benefit from their expertise. Funding could come from PGF, incentivizing people to share, support, mentor, build, and create. I feel that it’s important to keep education free so there are no barriers to knowledge. Again, this is just a thought to get a conversation started.
I literally just made a post about this. Great minds?
Wow!  What a coincidence!  I love it!
Great idea but how do you find funding to run the Uni?
Public goods funding?  I’m not sure.  Hoping to get people to come up with some good ideas.

Education is always critical, and in this case, a great onboarding mechanism for new entrants to Optimism, Ethereum and blockchain in general. My suggestion is to keep it light and low cost to begin with. Something as simple as a dedicated small Optimism team to create content for a YouTube Channel, a free Udemy courses, or ideally Coursera …or is there a decentralised Web3 platform? That’s my two cents. Overall, I support this Idea.
Great idea! I think the exposure itself for creators to showcase tools and their knowledge would be beneficial enough for them to want to create.

Yep, get the projects involved to create content. That’s a good idea, on top of a good idea! EDIT: Sorry about the duplicate Post. I wasn’t sure if I was replying to @Karlos7785 so I duplicated it. The first post is now deleted.
I love this idea. Educate people about the protocol. Knowledge is power!!
Great idea!  It’s probably best to start out small as you say, and then it can grow into whatever form from there.  Not sure about a decentralized web3 platform.
Interesting. How would a Hub giving away free courses benefit the Optimism?

To help train developers, creators, builders, investors, etc. than can all in turn contribute to innovation on Optimism.  Basically we would be supporting and nurturing growth, knowledge, and the development of skills, with the side effects of innovation, appreciation,  and trust.   I can’t think of how that wouldn’t benefit Optimism even if some people used what they learned elsewhere.
Hey we have something similar here: [DRAFT] [GF: Phase 1] EthernautDao (Dev Education) We focus on developer education and we think it is important to coordinate efforts. Any feedback is welcome!

Our bottleneck now is how to identify and locate those contributors to give them the EXP token. We have a lot o them inside the DAO but we should reach out to other developer communities and coordinate efforts to bring everyone in!
This is great. I also generally think that a university type system is always great for any ecosystem.

I came from here:    Develop web3 curriculum to help grow crypto 💌 Ideas & Feedback       One of the big issues in the crypto space is the knowledge gap that separates active users from the wider crypto community and non crypto users.  Part of the reason for this is that there is too much information spread over a bunch of different mediums. The crypto curious and new users need to be good at researching and understanding information without anyone to guide them. I have university educated friends who are interested in crypto but don’t know where to start.  A clear path to understand…     As the Op of this link posted: we really need to bring no coiners to the community. Nobody thinks about those who are far from this technology and they have too much experience and value to share. I think we should keep thinking in how to give a step in this direction.
Great idea i like always good to learn!

It would be great for some OP holders to share their knowledge being rewarded by some karma. It’s a matter of stopping thinking about individualism and being incentivized to make the collective stronger.

Hello, revamping this thread I just wanted to let you know guys we are starting to give EXP tokens to those who create developer’s educational content. It’ll be nice to compile all this in one place and start some sort of university.
It woul be important to have it in an easy to check place. This forum?  A Wiki? Gitbook? Any idea? Education about gobernance would be important too.

I love the idea, and that’s a great way of seeing it. If it can create a memorable onboarding experience or a learning opportunity that brings real value to people, they would have very positive associations with Optimism long-term.

Gonna.eth:  [DRAFT] [GF: Phase 1] EthernautDao (Dev Education)   Hey-- following up here because am wondering if there have been any developments on OP education? Think it is a fantastic idea, but am interested in execution efforts. Would agree with prev. comments that lighter lift via YouTube might be good. Potentially enlisting a group known for work like a “WhiteBoard Crypto” might be a good way to outsource some of this work to a channel that has a pretty established platform and has developed a strong reputation.
We may open a thread to brainstorm ideas to do that: some wiki, special education threads, or Discord channels, …

100%. I’m facing language barriers and I believe that a course would be an easier place to translate texts: divided into topics and with options for different languages some topics i would like to see  blockchain and public goods optimism Retroactive funding Quadratic funding
How about a study group?
That’s an good point @fcarva.eth, I do think this space is very heavily anglocentric still. Would love to see some quality translations to reach even more people
Definitely a good point – what are some of the bigger global language communities we could target? First languages that come to mind are: Chinese, Spanish, French, and Portuguese.

Agreed… Thailand seems to be an integral part of OP network so don’t leave them out of the equation here. I have been working really hard to gather a global community and find translation help… We are using a peer 2 peer educational token rewards protocol called PEERANHA to help educate our international users. We are also building an educational NFT platform which may help serve as an educational hub for collectors and creators about Optimism. It is going to be focusing on Public Goods and educational content related to OP governance. I’m thinking an attestation station built in related to gov education is also in our plans now after learning about the integration recently.
Love this idea may be this is a way to educated people about OP
